headings: It’s said teaching is the one profession that creates all other professions.
B.S. in Interdisciplinary Studies - Grades 4-8 Generalist with Teacher Certification
What Can You Do With an Education Degree?
Why Earn My Teaching Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: Becoming a teacher allows you to make a daily impact. If you are interested in opening doors for students to expand their knowledge and achieve their educational goals, our 4-8 Generalist Degree with Teacher Certification might be for you.

In our program, you have two specialization options to choose from, Generalist or English Language Arts and Reading. Whichever you choose, our faculty will prepare you to become an effective educator in today’s teaching environment. You’ll receive hands-on course instruction, as well as multiple practicum opportunities to prepare you to work with a multicultural population of learners.
Contact Information
Angelo State University is accredited by theTexas Education Agencyto recommend candidates for state educator initial certification and for additional certification.
Early Childhood - Grade 6
Grades 4-8
Grades 7-12
Early Childhood - Grade 12

Our faculty are all experienced educators who will work alongside you to help prepare you for the not-so-distant day you become a teacher in your own classroom. During your practicums, you’ll also be mentored by tenured teachers at local and regional school districts.
Education Faculty and Staff
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.

Our program will prepare you to be a grade 4-8 teacher in public and private schools throughout Texas. Our graduates have a 94% pass rate on the Texas teacher certification exam, and many have won Teacher of the Year Awards in their respective school districts and regions.
Explore Career Possibilities

Get right into the classroom for early field experience as you shadow local teachers and even teach your own lessons early in your education courses. As you get closer to graduation, you’ll become part of our student-teacher program and work with local school districts throughout the region.

Receive quality information, guidance and support services through our Educator Preparation Information Center (EPI Center). We’re here to help support you through your college journey and provide academic and career path advising.

The Teacher Education Assistance for College and Higher Education (TEACH) Grant Program provides grants of up to $4,000 per year to students who intend to teach in a high-need field in a public or private elementary or secondary school that serves students from low-income families.

Take your education to the next level in theASU Honors Program. Through special courses, cultural events, research and community engagement, we’ll help you transform your intellectual and personal talents into marketable skills for your future. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in prestigious internships, fellowships and other programs to reach your full potential.
Explore the Honors Advantage

OurFreshman Collegeis a one-stop resource for programs and services that help you transition into college life, improve your communication skills, and engage in active learning. You can also get academic help in theMath LabandWriting Center, receive peer mentoring and tutoring throughSupplemental Instruction, or set up onlinetutoringsessions.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
ApplyVisit UsRequest Info

Dr. Stephanie Howard, Class of 1995, Education

“ASU prepared me to be a teacher in the classroom by having dedicated professors who love education and have a passion for teaching children and those who teach them.”

Jacque Cunningham, Class of 2006, B.S. in Teacher Education

“The foundation that was established in the College of Education at Angelo State is what has provided me the opportunities I have had over the past 28 years in the profession. My time there was great even though it wasn’t a traditional experience. I absolutely love Angelo State.”

Dr. Stephanie Howard, Class of 1995, Education
